text: I joke half-heartedly, “What, are you two planning to share one room?”
The moment the words leave my mouth, the air falls silent for half a second.
“Would sharing be so bad?” Lucia blinks, her expression filled with genuine confusion.
Alicia frowns slightly, her tone calm yet edged with unmistakable firmness. “Separate rooms would be better.”
I pause, realizing my remark was a bit inappropriate, and let out an awkward laugh to cover it up. “Ah, I was just joking.”
She offers no further comment, only nodding faintly. “Then please prepare another room for Lucia.”
Sensing the shift in mood, Lucia tugs lightly at her cloak. “Master, let’s go upstairs.”
Alicia turns and walks away, her silhouette stretched long by the firelight at the foot of the stairs.
I let out a sigh, looking down at the ledger on the counter, suddenly feeling the room grow quieter than before.
